title: Bug 38131: ajc needs -d . option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB:
After executing the 'ajc subpackage\Test.java' command, a directory named "subpackage" is created within the existing "subpackage" directory. The compiled class file (Test.class) is placed within this new subpackage directory.
Attempting to run the compiled class using the 'java' command results in the following error:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: subpackage/Test
EB:
Running either of the following commands should resolve the problem:
- ajc -d . subpackage\Test.java
- javac subpackage\Test.java
